div.h2: Welcome to Littlestown Area School District

div.p: The Littlestown Area Schools serve the Littlestown community:

Union and Germany townships, the borough of Littlestown, and portions of Mt. Joy and Mt. Pleasant townships and Bonneauville borough in southeastern Adams County, Pennsylvania. District offices are housed in the Alloway Creek Building. The schools make up a campus on the east side of Littlestown, and are within walking distance of each other.

The Littlestown Area School District is an equal opportunity education institution and will not discriminate in its educational programs, activities, or employment practices on the basis of race, color, national origin, gender, age, religion, ancestry, disability, union membership, or other legally protected classification. Announcement of this policy is in accordance with state and federal laws, including Title VI, Title IX, and Section 504. Inquiries regarding (1) civil rights; (2) grievance problems; (3) services, activities and facilities that are accessible to and usable by disabled persons; or (4) employee or participant complaints of harassment or discrimination, should be directed to Dr. Carolyn Rhodes, 162 Newark St., Littlestown, PA 17340, phone 717-359-4146.

h3.a: LASD's Art Department wants you to take on our Famous Portrait Challenge!

div.p: Anyone in the community is welcome to play! Check out the link for info. Don't forget to tag your posts on social media with #boltsportraitchallenge

h3.a: Notification of Remote Regular Board Meeting on April 20, 2020 at 7:00 PM

div.p: The School Board will meet in a remote Regular Meeting on Monday, April 20, 2020 at 7:00 PM

h3.a: NOMINATIONS are still OPEN for the 2019-2020 Outstanding Staff Awards!

div.p: Submit your online Nominations for the 2019-2020 outstanding staff awards. It's easy and only takes a couple minutes. Deadline for nominations is May 15, 2020.

h3.a: Notification of Remote Curriculum, Co-Curriculum, & Policy Committee Meeting on April 14, 2020 at 5:00 PM

div.p: The School Board Curriculum, Co-Curriculum, & Policy Committee will hold a remote committee meeting on Thursday, April 14, 2020 at 5:00 PM.

h3.a: Recording of the Remote Work Session Board Meeting held on April 6, 2020

div.p: Watch this LHS Student Council Video and enter your chance to win! Three random submissions will be picked to win one of three $50 Gift Cards to LaBella's, Kennies, or Firehouse Grill.

h3.a: Notification of Remote Board Work Session on April 6, 2020

div.p: The School Board will meet remotely in a Work Session on Monday, April 6, 2020 at 6:00 PM. The Board Room will be open at ACES through Door #12 starting at 5:45 PM for public to attend a livestreaming event if unable to view on your device.
